tit.cmt: Point (Sentoki)としました。なお以下ではpointとしました。

sen.j: 尖頭器（せんとうき、point）とは、先端を鋭く尖らせた打製石器のこと。
sen.e: Sentoki is a sharp-pointed chipped stone tool.
Point ('sentoki' in Japanese) is a sharp-pointed chipped stone tool.
sen.cmt: Point ('sentoki' in Japanese)としました。
sen.e: Point ('sentoki' in Japanese) is a sharp-pointed chipped stone tool.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 旧石器時代に現れる。
sen.e: It emerged in Paleolithic Period
It appeared in the Paleolithic period
sen.cmt: 定冠詞をつけるなど、用語を少し変えました
sen.e: It appeared in the Paleolithic period
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 尖頭器は、諸外国では広い意味をもち、先端が鋭く尖った石器の総称として用いられるのに対し、日本では刃潰し剥離によって仕上げられた石器については「ナイフ形石器」と呼んで、尖頭器とは区別する。
sen.e: Sentoki (pointed stone tool) has broad meaning and is a general term for sharp-pointed stone tool in foreign countries while in Japan the flake tools whose edges were dulled except the sharpest edge left for the blade are called 'knife-like stone tool,' and are distinguished form sentoki.
sen.cmt: 剥片自身がもつ鋭い側縁の一部をナイフの刃のように残し、ほかの側縁を鈍くつぶす調整剥離
sen.e: The point has a broad meaning and is the general term for sharp-pointed stone tools in foreign countries, while in Japan the term 'sentoki' (point) excludes the flake tools whose edges were dulled by pressure with the sharpest edge left for the blade by calling them 'knife-like stone tool.'
sen.cmt: 構文、用語を少し変えました。刃潰し剥離：whose edges were dulled by pressure with the sharpest edge left for the bladeとしてありますが、術語なので確認をお願いいたします。
sen.e: The archaeological term "point" has a broad meaning and in foreign countries, it is generally used to refer to sharp-pointed stone tools; in Japan, however, the term for "point" (sentoki) is not used to refer to stone tools with one edge blunted by the removal of tiny flakes (these are instead called 'knife-like stone tools').
sen.cmt: 刃潰し剥離＝「剥片自身がもつ鋭い側縁の一部をナイフの刃のように残し、ほかの側縁を鈍くつぶす調整剥離」

sen.j: さらに、約3万年以前の尖頭器、最終氷期最寒冷期以後の槍先形尖頭器、縄文時代の石槍など、製作ないし使用された年代の相違を考慮し、それぞれを呼び分ける場合も多い。
sen.e: In addition, it is often the case that respevtive stone tools are called differently such as the sentoki of more than about 30 thousand yeas ago, the lanceolate sentoki of the age after the coldest time during the last glacial period and the stone spear of the Jomon Period considering the difference of the time when these stone tools were made and used.

In addition, these stone tools are often called by different names considering the difference of the time when these stone tools were made or used, such as those made more than 30 thousand yeas ago called simply 'point,' those appeared soon after the coldest period of the Last Glacial Maximum called 'lanceolate-shaped point,' those of the Jomon period called 'stone spear.'
sen.cmt: 構文、用語を少し変えました。槍先形尖頭器：lanceolate-shaped point としてあります。
sen.e: In addition, these stone tools are often called by different names considering the difference of the time when these stone tools were made or used, such as those made more than 30 thousand yeas ago called simply 'point,' those appeared soon after the coldest period of the Last Glacial Maximum called 'lanceolate-shaped point,' those of the Jomon period called 'stone spear.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 旧石器時代の研究が進展するにともない、縄文時代の石槍もポイント（尖頭器）と呼ばれるケースが増えており、その場合は後期旧石器時代から縄文時代にかけての槍先形の石器（上記の2.と3.）を呼称する。
sen.e: As the study of the Paleolithic Period develops, the cases are increased that stone spears of the Jomon Period are called 'pointed' (sentoki), and in those cases they are called lanceolate stone tools of the age between upper Palaeolithic Period and the Jomon Period (2 and 3 noted above).

Along with the progress of the study of the Paleolithic period, many of the stone spears of the Jomon period have classified as 'point' (sentoki), and specifically the lanceolate stone tools of the ages between upper Paleolithic period and the Jomon period are called 'point' (the 2nd and 3rd examples mentioned above).
sen.cmt: 用語を少し変えました。
sen.e: Along with the progress of the study of the Paleolithic period, many of the stone spears of the Jomon period have classified as 'point' (sentoki), and specifically the lanceolate stone tools of the ages between upper Paleolithic period and the Jomon period are called 'point' (the 2nd and 3rd examples mentioned above).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 木の柄につけて投げ槍とし、大型獣の狩りに用いられたのが槍先形尖頭器の始まりで、狩猟に大きな進歩をもたらした。
sen.e: The lanceolate sentoki, to which wooden-shaft was attached, started to be used as a javelin to hunt large-size animals, and it brought a great development to hunting.

The lanceolate-shaped point first appeared when the people began attaching a point to a wooden-shaft and using it as a javelin to hunt large-size animals, and it brought about a great development to hunting.
sen.cmt: 構文、用語を少し変えました。
sen.e: The lanceolate-shaped point first appeared when the people began attaching a point to a wooden-shaft and using it as a javelin to hunt large-size animals, and it brought about a great development to hunting.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.j: 槍先形尖頭器の出現と発達
tit.e: The advent and development of lanceolate sentoki
The appearance and development of the lanceolate-shaped point
tit.cmt: 用語を変えました：advent→appearancelanceolate sentoki→the lanceolate-shaped point
tit.e: The appearance and development of the lanceolate-shaped point

sen.j: 日本では、尖頭器（槍先形尖頭器）は旧石器時代のナイフ形石器の盛行期（約2万年前から約1万5千年前まで）に出現している。
sen.e: In Japan sentoki (lanceolate sentoki) appeared in the period when the knife-like stone tool flourished (from about 20 thousand years ago to 15 thousand years ago) during the Paleolithic Period.
In Japan the point (lanceolate-shaped point) appeared when the knife-like stone tool was at the peak (from about 20 thousand years to 15 thousand years ago) during the Paleolithic period.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。
sen.e: In Japan the point (lanceolate-shaped point) appeared when the knife-like stone tool was at the peak (from about 20 thousand years to 15 thousand years ago) during the Paleolithic period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その起源はナイフ形石器から発展変化したとも、ユーラシア大陸からもたらされたものともいわれるが、未だに解決されていない。
sen.e: Its origin is said to have developed and changed from the knife-like stone tools or to have been brought from the Eurasian Continent, but still left unsolved.
It is said to have been developed and evolved from the knife-like stone tools or brought from the Eurasian Continent, but its origin is not still unknown.
sen.cmt: 構文を少し変えました。
sen.e: It is said to have been developed and evolved from the knife-like stone tools or brought from the Eurasian Continent, but its origin is not still unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ナイフ形石器は後期旧石器時代末葉に衰退していくが、代わって槍先形尖頭器は著しく発達し、量的にもめざましく増加する。
sen.e: The knife-like stone tools were fading at the end of upper Palaeolithic Period, and instead, the lanceolate sentoki developed remarkably and increased in quantity.
While the knife-like stone tools went fading at the end of upper Paleolithic period, the lanceolate-shaped point remarkably developed with a big production increase.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。
sen.e: While the knife-like stone tools went fading at the end of upper Paleolithic period, the lanceolate-shaped point remarkably developed with a big production increase.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 槍先形尖頭器は、細石器が多用された時期には一時的に減少傾向をみせるが、縄文土器が出現する前後に最盛期をむかえる。
sen.e: The lanceolate sentoki saw a downward trend temporarily but peaked around the time when Jomon ware emerged.
The use of lanceolate-shaped point decreased temporarily during the period in which the microlith was widely used, but it reached its peaked around the time when the Jomon were began to be developed.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。
sen.e: The use of lanceolate-shaped point decreased temporarily during the period in which the microlith was widely used, but it reached its peaked around the time when the Jomon were began to be developed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そこで、細石器段階以前を初期尖頭器、以降を発達期の尖頭器と呼ぶこともあるが、両者の差異はかなり顕著である。
sen.e: So occasionally, the sentoki before microlith is called early sentoki and the one after microlith is called sentoki in formative period, but the difference between them is prominent.

Therefore, the point before the appearance of microlith is called 'early point' and the one after microlith is called 'point in developing period,' and the difference between these styles is considerably remarkable.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。
sen.e: Therefore, the point before the appearance of microlith is called 'early point' and the one after microlith is called 'point in developing period,' and the difference between these styles is considerably remarkable.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 前者は一般的に比較的小形のものが多く、調整も周辺部調整、片面調整、両面調整と多様であるのに対し、後者は長大なものが加わり、大半が両面調整のものへと定式化されていく。
sen.e: While most of the former type were relatively small in general and had diverse retouch such as retouch on surrounding part, retouch on one face and on both faces of the tools, the latter included the heavyweight types and most of them were stylized to be bifacial retouched.

While most of the former types were relatively small in size and processed with diverse ways of further reduction, such as retouch on the surrounding part, retouch on one face and on both faces of the tools, the latter included the large and heavyweight types and most of them were stylized to be retouched on both sides.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。調整：retouchを使いましたが、術語と思われます。
sen.e: While most of the former were relatively small in size and processed using diverse ways of achieving further reductions (such as retouching of the surrounding part of the tool or on one or both of the tool's faces), the latter included large, heavyweight types of points, most of which were formed in such a way as to allow them to be retouched on both sides.
sen.cmt: 一部修正しました。

sen.j: また後者には有舌（有茎）尖頭器がともなうようになる。
sen.e: And the hafted (stemmed) stone tools were added to the latter type.
And the style of hafted (stemmed) point was added to the latter type.
sen.cmt: 有舌（有茎）尖頭器：hafted (stemmed) pointを使いました。
sen.e: And the style of hafted (stemmed) point was added to the latter type.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 縄文時代の槍先形尖頭器は上述の発達期尖頭器の後半部にあたる。
sen.e: The age lanceolate sentoki were used in the Jomon Period is the latter half of formative period sentoki mentioned above.
The lanceolate-shaped point used in the Jomon period corresponds to the latter generation of the point in developing period mentioned above.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。
sen.e: The lanceolate-shaped point used in the Jomon period corresponds to the latter generation of the point in developing period mentioned above.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.e: Classification and chronology of the point
Classification and chronology of the point

sen.j: 槍先形尖頭器の分類はこれまで、形態による分類（木葉形、半月形、有舌、有肩など）と調整部位による分類（周辺調整、片面調整、両面調整）がおこなわれているが、明瞭な型式分類が設定されるには至っていない。
sen.e: The lanceolate sentoki has been classified according to the form (leaf-shaped, half-moon-shaped, hafted, shouldered) and the parts of retouched (retouch on surrounding part, one face and both faces), however, it has not undergone distinct form-classification.

The articles of lanceolate-shaped point are classified according to the forms (leaf-shaped, half-moon-shaped, hafted, shouldered) and the parts retouched (retouch on the surrounding part, one face and both faces), however, the categorical classification has not been established yet.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。「木葉形、半月形、有舌、有肩」・「周辺調整、片面調整、両面調整」の英文の正式な術語は不明です。
sen.e: The articles of lanceolate-shaped point are classified according to the forms (leaf-shaped, half-moon-shaped, hafted, shouldered) and the parts retouched (retouch on the surrounding part, one face and both faces), however, the categorical classification has not been established yet.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: かつて芹沢長介は有舌尖頭器を形態上の差異に着目して4群に分け、その変遷過程を示している（1966）。
sen.e: Chosuke SERIZAWA once classified hafted sentoki into 4 groups focusing on their morphological differences and presented the transition history (1966).
Chosuke SERIZAWA once classified the hafted point into four groups focusing on their morphological differences and presented a theory on their transition (1966).
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変えました。
sen.e: Chosuke SERIZAWA once classified the hafted point into four groups focusing on their morphological differences and presented a theory on their transition (1966).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後の資料の増加によって芹沢による編年は若干の修正を必要とするとみなされているが、大筋では、長身で幅が狭く舌部の返しの未発達なものから、基部の返しが鋭くなったものへと変遷することは広く認められている。
sen.e: Even though the chronology by SERIZAWA is considered to need some amendment because the material increased afterward, the broad outline of his point of view that its form changed from elongated one with primitive lingual part of barb into the one with sharp barb of the bottom is accepted.

Even though the chronology by SERIZAWA has been considered to need some revisions along with the increased materials unearthed afterward, the general line of his argument that the form went changing from the elongated one with a primitive lingual barb to the one with a sharp bottom barb is widely accepted.
sen.cmt: 表現、用語を一部変えました。舌部の返し： lingual barb としましたが、ご確認ください。
sen.e: Even though the chronology proposed by SERIZAWA is believed to need revision as a result of the increased number of materials unearthed since then, his general line of argument that the form underwent a change from being an elongated point with a primitive lingual barb to being one with a sharp bottom barb is widely accepted.
sen.cmt: 修正しました。

tit.j: 動物相の変化と尖頭器の消長
tit.e: Evolution of fauna and prevalence of sentoki
Evolution of fauna and the prevalence and disappearance of the point
tit.cmt: 尖頭器の消長：the prevalence and disappearance of the point
tit.e: Evolution of fauna and the prevalence and disappearance of the point

sen.j: 洪積世（更新世）末から沖積世（完新世）初頭にかけては、日本のみならず北アメリカ大陸・アジア大陸においても尖頭器の発達が著しい。
sen.e: Not only in Japan but also in North American continent and Asian continent sentoki were improved remarkably from diluvial epoch (pleistocene epoch) to the early alluvial epoch (holocene epoch).

Not only in Japan but also in the North American continent and the Asian continent, the point achieved a remarkable development from the end of the diluvial epoch (Pleistocene epoch) to the early alluvial epoch (Holocene epoch).
sen.cmt: 一部用語を変えました：the point achieved a remarkable development
sen.e: Not only in Japan but also in the North American continent and the Asian continent, the point achieved a remarkable development from the end of the diluvial epoch (Pleistocene epoch) to the early alluvial epoch (Holocene epoch).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これらの地域ではマンモスやバイソンなど洪積世の寒冷気候を好んだ大形獣を対象とする狩猟具が求められ、投げ槍の槍先として用いられた各種尖頭器の出現をみた。
sen.e: In these areas tools for hunting large-size animals such as mammoth and bison which liked cool climate of diluvial epoch were needed and various types of sentoki used as the head of javelins emerged.

In these areas people needed the tools for hunting large-size animals such as mammoth and bison that were well adjusted in the cool climate of the diluvial epoch, and various forms of points came to be used as the head of javelins.
sen.cmt: 一部用語、表現を変えました。
sen.e: In these areas people needed the tools for hunting large-size animals such as mammoth and bison that were well adjusted in the cool climate of the diluvial epoch, and various forms of points came to be used as the head of javelins.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 日本においても、当初は大形獣を対象とした狩猟具として生まれたが、洪積世末期に縄文海進によって大陸から切り離され、大形獣の絶滅が早かったという特殊な条件が加わって、イノシシ・ニホンジカなどが主な狩猟対象となった。
sen.e: Also in Japan they were generated as the tools for hunting large-size animals at first, but with the specific conditions that Japan was isolated from the mainland through Jomon transgression at the end of diluvial epoch and large-size animals died out earlier, hog and Japanese deer became the main game animals.

Also in Japan, the point developed as a tool for hunting large-size animals at first, but owing to the specific conditions that Japan was isolated from the mainland through the Jomon transgression at the end of the diluvial epoch and large-sized animals died out earlier, hogs and Japanese dears became the main game animals.
sen.cmt: 一部用語、表現を変えました。
sen.e: Also in Japan, the point developed as a tool for hunting large-size animals at first, but owing to the specific conditions that Japan was isolated from the mainland through the Jomon transgression at the end of the diluvial epoch and large-sized animals died out earlier, hogs and Japanese dears became the main game animals.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これらの、嗅覚が鋭く行動の機敏な動物の捕獲には、手持ちの槍よりも投げ槍が狩猟具として適していたものと考えられ、特に有舌尖頭器の急増は、こうした事情を物語っていると推定される。
sen.e: A javelin was considered more suitable than a spear as a tool for hunting of these sharp-nosed and nimble animals, and it is presumed that particularly rapid increase in hafted sentoki is explained by these circumstances.

A javelin was considered more suitable than a spear as a tool for hunting these sharp-nosed and nimble animals, and probably the particularly rapid increase of the hafted point can be explained by these reasons.
sen.cmt: 一部用語、表現を変えました。
sen.e: A javelin was considered more suitable than a spear as a tool for hunting these sharp-nosed and nimble animals, and probably the particularly rapid increase of the hafted point can be explained by these reasons.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: やがて弓矢の発明とともに、タヌキやウサギなどの小動物も狩猟対象となっていった。
sen.e: Later, when bows and arrows were invented, small animals such as raccoon dogs and hares became game animals too.
Later, when the bow and arrows was invented, small animals such as raccoon dogs and hares also became game animals.
sen.cmt: 一部用語、冠詞の使い方を変えました。
sen.e: Later, when the bow and arrows was invented, small animals such as raccoon dogs and hares also became game animals.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、弓矢と槍の中間的な機能を果たした投げ槍（槍先形尖頭器）は弓矢の普及によって消滅していく。
sen.e: With the widespread of bows and arrows, javelins (lanceolate sentoki) which functioned as an intermediate role between bows and arrows and spears disappeared.
With the widespread use of bow and arrow, javelins (lanceolate-shaped point), which functioned as a transit tool between the bow and arrows and the spear, ceased to exist.
sen.cmt: 一部用語を変えました。
sen.e: With the widespread use of bow and arrow, javelins (lanceolate-shaped point), which functioned as a transit tool between the bow and arrows and the spear, ceased to exist.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一方で、縄文時代前期以降は採集・漁撈の充実および定住生活のいっそうの進展とともに落とし穴を利用する待ち伏せ狩猟も増加していくのである。
sen.e: On the other hand, after the early Jomon Period as the forage and fish catching were enhanced and the settled way of life progressed, ambush-style hunting with pitfalls also increased.

On the other hand, since after the early Jomon period, the development of foraging and fish catching as well as the advancement of the settled way of life lead to the increase of ambush hunting with pitfalls.
sen.cmt: 一部用語、表現を変えました。
sen.e: On the other hand, since after the early Jomon period, the development of foraging and fish catching as well as the advancement of the settled way of life lead to the increase of ambush hunting with pitfalls.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
